pros: working with youth in need of services
cons: Some locations are difficult to get to

review_title: An okay job, not enough work to do
pros: Get to work with troubled youth in the community. Free time during work when kids are not in to do whatever you want.
cons: Pay is low. Work is very sporadic, almost too much down time. It is always preached that you are "making a difference" when in reality it is more of a babysitting service.

review_title: Good agency with the usual non profit struggles
pros: Great experience working with youth in need you can see the impact you have on youth first hand. Overall stable agency with well taken care of locations.
cons: Many poor middle managers that seemed to struggle with connecting to staff and youth. Low pay in many positions. Lack of leadership in some locations. A few staff whose personal problems are brought to work a lot.

pros: Love it. Been here for a few years and the people make work not feel like work. Plus what we do is so critical to the community.
cons: Not enough pay unless you stay for a few years

job_title: Recreation Attendant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Flexible time schedule, positive atmosphere, and motivational
cons: Only offers part time positions without benefits

pros:
People believe in the work they do. 
You get to be a part of something bigger than yourself.
Great starting pay in comparison to similar positions with other local nonprofits. 
They really emphasize work/life balance and are aware of burnout.
The executive director is amazing and has really established a great culture.
cons: Competitive starting salary but few opportunities for promotion/advancement. They take care of you and you are encouraged to make lateral career moves if something opens up internally that you are interested in, but expect to be content with what you do long-term because there are few supervisory positions. This isn't really something that they can fix or change, it's just the nature of what The Link does.

pros: Programs developed with youth voice, visions and input.
cons: Growing very fast. Many programs all in beginning stages.

pros: amazing coworkers who share amazing passion for this work
cons: there was little support from supervisors

pros: A lot of free time/freedom at work
cons: Employees aren't treated great, pay is low

pros: I like to work in a good reputed company and it is my desire to serve my best to the Customers.
